definition.name: NXoptical_system_em
definition.doc: A container for qualifying an electron optical system.

field.name: camera_length
field.doc: Citing the JEOL TEM glossary this is *an effective distance from a specimen to a plane where an observed diffraction pattern is formed*.

field.name: magnification
field.doc: The factor of enlargement of the apparent size, not physical size, of an object.

field.name: defocus
field.doc: The defocus aberration constant oftentimes taken as the C_1_0 which is described in more details in NXaberration.

field.name: semi_convergence_angle
field.doc: Citing the JEOL TEM glosssary this is the value *when a cone shaped, convergent electron beam illuminates a specimen, the semi-angle of the cone is termed convergence angle.*

field.name: field_of_view
field.doc: The extent of the observable parts of the specimen given the current magnification and other settings of the instrument.

field.name: working_distance
field.doc: Citing `Globalsino <https://www.globalsino.com/EM/page4586.html>`_ this is *a distance between the specimen and the lower pole piece in SEM system*.

field.name: beam_current
field.doc: Beam current as measured relevant for the illumination of the specimen. Users should specify further details like how the beam current was measured using the beam_current_description field.

field.name: beam_current_description
field.doc: Specify further details how the beam current was measured or estimated.
